thread.title: The First Black 'Bachelorette' Is Finally Happening
thread.title_full: The First Black 'Bachelorette' Is Finally Happening

title: The First Black 'Bachelorette' Is Finally Happening
text: The First Black 'Bachelorette' Is Finally Happening Most Popular By Alyssa Bailey Feb 13, 2017 For the first time in 30+ combined seasons, The Bachelor and Bachelorette franchise is getting its first black lead, according to Hollywood Reporter . The next Bachelorette is to be announced as Rachel Lindsay, a Texas attorney currently competing on The Bachelor this season, tonight on Jimmy Kimmel Live! . A photo posted by Rachel Lindsay (@therachlindsay) on Feb 3, 2017 at 2:50pm PST Advertisement - Continue Reading Below The news of the historic casting deviates from the show's tradition of unveiling its next Bachelorette/Bachelor at the end of the current season. (It also reveals ahead of time that Lindsay is not ultimately current Bachelor Nick Viall's pick.) ABC declined to comment on the news for now. A photo posted by Rachel Lindsay (@therachlindsay) on Dec 7, 2016 at 5:51pm PST More from ELLE:
